image.altText: Little penguins on a beach, lit by red light.

props.synopsis: After an 'unprecedented' drop in numbers, adult little penguins have begun returning to an east coast Tasmanian town, with scientists predicting winter breeding is to come.

title.children: 'They're back, I can hear them': Community's relief at return of little penguins

image.altText: A mock-up of a stadium superimposed in a suburban environment.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian premier has told state parliament there will be no Tasmania Devils AFL team — unless MPs pass special legislation to enable a stadium to be built at Hobart's Macquarie Point and stop the current planning process for the stadium.

title.children: Rockliff gives MPs ultimatum on stadium as new images released by opponents

image.altText: Man speaking at a news press conference outdoors with a woman beside him

props.synopsis: Rhyan Davey spent two years waiting for social housing. As wait times reach a record high, Tasmania's community service sector wants the government to reassess its housing strategy.

title.children: Rhyan lived out of a motel with his kids amid two-year wait for housing

image.altText: Two men in suits outside a sandstone building.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian minister Eric Abetz says the government has not been misleading on the amount of taxpayer funding needed to build the stadium.

title.children: 'Plus borrowings': Abetz says premier not misleading on 'not one red cent more' stadium promise

image.altText: House fire Harristown

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to Merritt Street in Harristown about 12.30am on Wednesday, where they found the house engulfed in flames.

title.children: Mother under police guard after house fire that killed three children

image.altText: Rubble covers the ground of a mosque that was hit by Indian missile attack.

props.synopsis: As the world waits with bated breath to see what will happen next between India and Pakistan, there are signs the conflict between the two nuclear-armed states may have reached a plateau.

title.children: Pakistan vows revenge for air strikes, but signals willingness to de-escalate

image.altText: A clear blue sky over paddocks in Auburn, SA

props.synopsis: As South Australia and Victoria continue to face drought and unseasonable heat, there has been a notable absence of major rain systems. So, what's going on?

title.children: Rainfall maps offer ominous insight where Australia's climate is headed

image.altText: Catholic Cardinals wearing red and white gowns lined up in two rows in the Sistine Chapel

props.synopsis: As the sun set over the Vatican, black smoke rose from the temporary chimney of the Sistine Chapel over thousands of faithful gathered in St Peter's Square. A new pope has not yet been elected.

title.children: Day one of the conclave in pictures as cardinals seek to pick new pope

image.altText: An old man with white hear wearing a blue suit jacket

props.synopsis: Joe Biden criticises his successor's approach to Ukraine ceasefire negotiations, among other policy initiatives, in his first interview since his White House exit.

title.children: 'Beneath America': Biden rebukes Trump in first interview since leaving office

image.altText: A pictured of a thin dog tied to a chain, its ribs are visible.

props.synopsis: The frozen semen of dogs with fighting bloodlines is being sold to overseas buyers, as an ABC investigation reveals international links between the illegal blood sport and Australia. Warning: This story contains graphic images and content involving animal cruelty.

title.children: Secretive, lucrative: Australia's links to the shadowy world of dog fighting

image.altText: A senior NSW Police officer mid-interview

props.synopsis: The outgoing head of NSW Police has said any recommendations handed down by a review into its work culture will be introduced, regardless of whether she is commissioner or not.

title.children: Departing commissioner says NSW Police will act on 'toxic' culture without her

image.altText: A man covers a body in white

props.synopsis: Journalist Yahya Sobeih had just posted a photo of his newborn daughter when he was killed by Israeli strikes on a crowded market.

title.children: More than 90 killed in Gaza strikes including journalist who just became dad

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is edging into positive territory after the the US president foreshadowed a major trade deal announcement tomorrow, with reports that it is with the UK. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX flat ahead of Trump trade deal, US futures rise

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Trump to announce first trade deal: reports

image.altText: Unidentified man being arrested inside home

props.synopsis: Police are working to identify people captured in videos shot through windows, including four children, and say no-one should have to fear a breach of privacy in their homes.

title.children: Police allege prowler secretly filmed 40 people inside their homes

image.altText: Men and children walk or stand on a small beach of yellow sand with palm trees fronting turquoise waters.

props.synopsis: Port Vila is rebuilding after a magnitude-7.3 earthquake — and residents see an opportunity to increase the city's tourism appeal.

title.children: Tourists flock back to city remaking itself after a deadly earthquake

image.altText: Nagi Maehashi, a Japanese Australian woman, smiles brightly as she stands at her kitchen bench, pastry brush in hand.

props.synopsis: A week after RecipeTin Eats founder Nagi Maehashi accused baker Brooke Bellamy of plagiarism, Maehashi has beaten her fellow cookbook author in a major prize.

title.children: Nagi's second book sold almost 300k copies last year. Now it's won a prize

image.altText: A woman in exercise clothes sitting on the floor about to eat a healthy poke bowl

props.synopsis: During perimenopause oestrogen levels begin to drop which decreases bone density and muscle mass.

title.children: Want to feel stronger in perimenopause? Prioritising protein can help

image.altText: A mournful woman closes her eyes as her heads tilts downwards.

props.synopsis: A vigil for domestic violence murder victims in Newcastle has paid tribute to Mackenzie Anderson on the day her mother met Chris Minns over her killer's sentence.

title.children: DV victim's mother meets NSW premier over killer's sentence

image.altText: A hand-reared at the islands Penguin Discovery Centre

props.synopsis: The City of Rockingham lobbies the WA government requesting the temporary closure of Penguin Island to visitors in a bid to boost its dwindling population of the bird.

title.children: Crisis time for penguins that gave WA island its name

image.altText: A small scaly earless dragon sits on a rock.

props.synopsis: The Canberra grassland earless dragon is critically endangered and there are fears it disappear forever. Environmentalists have expressed concerns over the construction of a new road that is impacting the species' habitat.

title.children: Plan to bring Australia's 'most endangered reptile species' back from the brink

image.altText: Two small dead octopuses washed up on muddy sand.

props.synopsis: A toxic algal bloom linked with marine deaths across South Australia has grown to an unprecedented scale and will only be stopped by a change in weather, Environment Minister Susan Close says.

title.children: SA's toxic algal bloom 'larger than we have ever seen before'

image.altText: A tray of oysters inside a plastic sleeve.

props.synopsis: Oyster farms on South Australia's Yorke Peninsula have voluntarily cordoned off their sites as health authorities investigate a toxin outbreak.

title.children: Millions of SA oysters quarantined over algae-linked toxin

image.altText: Nat Bartsch seated at a piano while holding a baby on her lap. She's playing the keys with her left hand.

props.synopsis: A century ago years ago, women composers were expected to give up their careers to raise a family. Composing mums today are still advocating to get the support they need to thrive.

title.children: Generations of women show motherhood isn't a barrier to composing music

image.altText: A very tight close up of an Aboriginal woman's face, blonde hair holding a serious but relaxed expression. Background blurred

props.synopsis: Overcrowding, poor access to healthcare, and antisocial behaviour in remote NT communities is pushing people into city centres. Once they arrive, it can be a cycle of temporary accommodation and homelessness.

title.children: Declining living standards in remote NT forces many into homelessness

image.altText: A man in a light blue beanie, hoodie and headphones staring into the distance

props.synopsis: The site of a regional social housing project promised seven years ago has become a squat for the homeless in Bendigo, Victoria.

title.children: Land for long-awaited housing project becomes homeless campground

image.altText: Three mothers with sombre looks outside the ACT Legislative Assembly.

props.synopsis: Bereaved Indigenous mothers turn their grief into strength as they welcome the ACT government's backing of a board of inquiry into the treatment of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander detainees.

title.children: Bereaved mothers welcome inquiry into treatment of Indigenous detainees

image.altText: An F/A-18 Super Hornet lands on the deck of an aircraft carrier

props.synopsis: Both members of the crew ejected before the jet plunged into the water and were recovered by a rescue helicopter, the official said.

title.children: Another US fighter jet falls into sea from Truman aircraft carrier, officials say

image.altText: Black and white photo of locomotive parked in front of sheds and railway line.

props.synopsis: Central Queensland rail enthusiasts are trying to ensure one of only two intact roundhouses in the Southern Hemisphere is not cleared for an athletes' village.

title.children: Historical railyards exempt from heritage laws for Olympic development

image.altText: A Black woman wearing glasses and a white jacket and top sits at a desk facing a man for a job interview.

props.synopsis: Australian employers are using artificial intelligence hiring systems for recruitment, but new research suggests the technology may "enable discrimination" against marginalised groups.

title.children: Will AI decide if you get your next job? New research says it could

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with a small Bluey toy and colourful dollhouse.

props.synopsis: More than 1,100 children may be left without daycare as the fate of centres run by the Genius childcare empire remains in limbo.

title.children: Millions in debt mounting as Genius childcare provider searches for lifeline

image.altText: Onjuli, left, stands behind Mikaella, right, in a park while both gaze softly at the camera, wearing black.

props.synopsis: Mikaella and Onjuli met 13 years ago: one was couch-surfing across Europe; the other was living in Bristol and had a sofa. Now they're married and write smutty books together.

title.children: This married couple wrote a smutty lesbian horror novel together

image.altText: A person using an accessible taxi ramp.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest community transport providers is turning away new clients in Queensland as surging demand and rising vehicle costs strain the service.

title.children: Surge in demand leaves vulnerable Australians without a ride

image.altText: A woman on a phone smiles

props.synopsis: Palestinian photojournalist Fatima Hassouna was "Gaza's eye". Her death marks another journalist killed during the Israel-Gaza war, which has now become the "worst ever conflict" for journalists.

title.children: Photojournalist Fatima Hassouna wanted 'a death the world will hear'
